remarks: The norm is a function from the base set into the reals.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.)
statement:
nmf2.n $e |- N = ( norm ` W ) $.
nmf2.x $e |- X = ( Base ` W ) $.
nmf2.d $e |- D = ( dist ` W ) $.
nmf2.e $e |- E = ( D |` ( X X. X ) ) $.
nmf2 $p |- ( ( W e. Grp /\ E e. ( Met ` X ) ) -> N : X --> RR ) $.
